DataElement.preferredName: Person Bloating Present EORTC Quality of Life Scale Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent a person"s reported feeling of abdominal distention associated with a feeling of fullness.

ValueDomain.preferredName: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Scale Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A group with aims to conduct, develop, coordinate, and stimulate laboratory and clinical research in Europe to improve the management of cancer and related problems by increasing survival but also patients' quality of life. There are more than 60 institutions and departments that have been recognized by EORTC as affiliated. These groups conduct, on a voluntary basis, laboratory research and/or clinical trials on all types of cancers using a multidisciplinary approach. EORTC maintains close working relationship with NCI and the British Cancer Research United Kingdom in London._The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness._an ordered reference standard._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a great amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.
A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Scale Score
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The aims of the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) are to conduct, develop, coordinate, and stimulate laboratory and clinical research in Europe to improve the management of cancer and related problems by increasing survival but also patients' quality of life. There are more than 60 institutions and departments that have been recognized by EORTC as affiliated. These groups conduct, on a voluntary basis, laboratory research and/or clinical trials on all types of cancers using a multidisciplinary approach. EORTC maintains close working relationship with NCI and the British Cancer Research United Kingdom in London.:The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.:an ordered reference standard.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.longName: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer
Concepts.definition: A group with aims to conduct, develop, coordinate, and stimulate laboratory and clinical research in Europe to improve the management of cancer and related problems by increasing survival but also patients' quality of life. There are more than 60 institutions and departments that have been recognized by EORTC as affiliated. These groups conduct, on a voluntary basis, laboratory research and/or clinical trials on all types of cancers using a multidisciplinary approach. EORTC maintains close working relationship with NCI and the British Cancer Research United Kingdom in London.

The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElement.origin: EORTC QLQ-Pan26: EORTC Quality of Life Questionnaire Pancreas 26
DataElement.changeDescription: CDEs curated for Lombardi Cancer Center to use in a C3D trial; CDEs comprise the EORTC QLQ-Pan26 tool to measure Quality of Life in Pancreatic cancer patients
